intro: Tanarius sumatranus, commonly known as the Sumatran tanarius, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests or secondary growth areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
